title: touch events are not proper when SKCanvas is in ScrollView
body:
I am translating, scaling and rotating paths on canvas. But my canvas size is large, so I have put it in `ScrollView`. After that I can't perform touch events properly. Paths are translated but only sometimes. The control gives scrolling first priority. 

Please give me suggestions.
Thank you.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I need some more information:
 - what platform? (iOS, Android, UWP)
 - is this Xamarin.Forms or Native?
 - what touch events? gesture recognizers or the new touch event handler?

comments.author: gayugokhale
comments.body:
Hello.. sorry for late

Required information :
1. I have tested only in Android not on iOs or UWP.
2. I am working on Xamarin.forms PCL project.
3. I am using touch native renderes. 

I have also tried scrollview in the given demo 
https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/xamarin-forms/SkiaSharpForms/SkiaSharpFormsDemos/
 but there also it failed.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I think the issue is that you are using gestures and a scroll view. Only one can receive events at a time.

It might be best to not use a scroll view, but rather just translate/rotate the actual canvas. This has the additional benefit that the canvas is smaller, and consumes less memory.

comments.author: charlesroddie
comments.body: Here is the approach planned to solve this: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2680
